TEXT.citation: Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation. (2020). 族語E樂園. https://web.klokah.tw/

S.FORM: tayhuk kuwing cu mapitu’ pincapngan cu wagi’ i papatiqan cu sawni’.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: papateq la, mawp i papatiqan i papsibaq, kumaal i pancang maha:“ca’rux! tubunani i papsibaq!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: kumaal cami kahabaag maha, “lawkah su’ papsibaq.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: mateq ga, pasibaqan cami ni papsibaq cu lalpu ka kayi’ na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

S.FORM: galgan niyam lumpu i papsibaq, maquwas cami uwi cu quwas na lalpu.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們也唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: payux ku baqun mu ka kayi’ na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Tayal languages.

S.FORM: musa’ kuwing mateq kariariax, makibaq kuwing kariariax cu kayi’ na Itaal, papapung mu i yaya’.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: ralu’ mu ga Kaynu’.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Kaynu’。
My name is Kaynu’.

S.FORM: ralu’ ni yaba’ mu ga Baycu’.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Baycu’。
My dad’s name is Baycu’.

S.FORM: ralu’ ni yaya’ mu ga Iwal.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Iwal。
My mother’s name is Iwal.

S.FORM: magalpu kaal mu kaal ka hani.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: kiya qutux qumisuwan na mamaliku mu, ralu’ niya’ ga Bawtu’, magalpu cu qutux kaal niya’ kaal ka hani.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Bawtu’，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Bawtu’, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: maglu cami mateq i qutux papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: balayq mu ki qumisuwan na mamaliku ku maquwas.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: balayq mu ku lumanguy, muhngeq kuwing ga, maglu cami ka qutux cu imuwag musa’ i lumanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: balayq mu ku makasbabaq cu giqas ka rawin, naki cami maglu musa’ i maquwas ru lumanguy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: ulaqi’ kuwing na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 我是泰雅族的小孩。
I am an Itaal child.

S.FORM: kiya i Tabilas ku imuwag niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在Tabilas。
Our family lives in Tabilas.

S.FORM: imagal cami ka qutux cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tugal cami ka matasasuwayi’ ka qutux cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: masiqun kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’, qumisuwan na mamaliku ru qumisuwan na kanayril.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ibabaweq i yaba’ mu, kinsac i yaba’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mahikang i yaya’ mu, kuwisang i yaya’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: makiya imuwag i yaba’ ga makaal cami na kayi’ na Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: muhngeq i hahangiqan gabagan ga mamati’ cami musa’ i tinqalangan.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: maglu cami kina ququmisuwan rumakaap cu taka.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: balayq mu cubalay ku qutux mu cu imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: maglu kuwing ki yaya’ musa’ magunawu’ cu sawni’.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: mataseq a kaal cu qaliyan, ini’ kagihaaq, ini’ uwi uw kakilux, mashahiyaw a bayhu.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: asi cami pasisamag ca rawq i maneq cu miyenpaw, halhul tagacbu’ ca hihihi’ ku wagi’.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: matanah a kaal la cu minaneq la.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: paqucan mu i yaya’ mha : “micuwa’ ka matanah a kaal la?”
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: kumaal i yaya’ maha, “kiiy ma’uwah a rahuwal ka bayhu la.”
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: ukas a hamhum ca kaal cu gabiyan, pakahtu a buliqu la.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: mausa’ cami i imuwag uwi la.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: sikaal mu cuku buliqu ku kisleq mu cu muwah kuwing imuwag maha,
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: “muwa’ na iqaat ma’uwah a bayhu ka mamati’, mausa’ kuwing i magunawu’ lawwi.”
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: kiya i kiyl na imuwag niyam ku papatiqan mu, humakay kuwing kariariariax i musa’ papatiqan, muwah imuwag ga humakay uwi.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ini’ ka rahuwal ku papatiqan niyam, ini’ ka habaag ku mateq, makbabaq cami kahabaag.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: masautu’ cami kahabaag ka ulullaqi’ i paptaliyuman, maglu i magunawu’ cu mari’, maglu i maskakaru’.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: maglu ki cami magunawu’ uwi ku papsibaq, asiga magqutux cu imuwag ku papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: cumaping cami kariariax, capingun niyam cu mauba’ cubalay ku papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: kiya ku ruma’ ga cumawm cu tuhung, karuma’ ga cumaping cu rawq.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: capingun niyam kahabaag ku iquiqung na papatiqan, mapararag cami kahabaag, mauba’ cubalay kariariax ku papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: minusa’ kuwing tinqalangan maskakaru’ ki yutas cuhisa’.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: ingsu cami cubalay ini’ pakitaal la, lungulungun mu cubalay hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: talan kuwing ni yutas ru paqaniqan kuwing niya’ cu bahat, panubuwan kuwing niya’ cu cha(外來語-客).
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: lalbing cubalay ku pinumuwa’ ni yutas ka bahat, sahahiya’ cubalay i niqun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: balayq mu uwi ku cha ni yutas, balayq uwi i nubun.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: pakuriax laga, gumlu kuwing i tumahuk cu kakriaxun ki yaki’.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: payux cubalay ku tinahuk ni yaki’, kiya a quleh, waylung, rilum ru aang na apit.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有飛鼠湯。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and flying squirrel soup.

S.FORM: kumnuriax laru’, musa’ cami kumiku’ cu paruxaw i papmuwaan cu paparuxaw.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: payux inagal ni yaki’ ka bunga’, cayi’ ru qinu, sipaaras kuwing niya’ muwah imuwag.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: mapugagay cami ga, kalun mu maha wahay cimu mitaal lawwi i babaw niya’.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: rasun cami ni papsibaq i aangayan cu qaqasinu cu sawni’, tibalung cami i balihun mabaynay cu aangay.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: mawp cami aangayan cu qaqasinu laru, kumaal i papsibaq maha, “pug ga kakbahneq, sug ga quruquru’, angay nanak cimu.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: kaicuun mu ku quru’, kahi’ kuwing ini’ kitaal cu quruquru’.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: payux ku talan mu ka kabahneq, manbahaag ca babaw na kahuneq, manbahaag i kiya manbahaag i runi, talan mu uwi ku puuk ka kiya i maqilaap ca kuug na kahuneq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: kiya a tasiyang, ramayi’ ru wakli’ i aangayan cu qaqasinu, iqaat kuwing minitaal na’ aring cunga’ cu qaqasinu ka hani, talan sawni’ laru maqas cubalay a qisleq.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: payux a ingal mu ka qalimu’ na qariwal, papkitaal mu i yaba’ ki yaya’.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: paglu kuwing ki yaba’, yaya’ muwah i babaw niya’.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: muhngeq kahani ga, masa’ kuwing ki iyah i Taytung maskakaru’ ki mama’.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: manaaring cami i Taype’ gumlu cu kulu’ na hapuneq musa’ i Taytung.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tayhuk cami i Taytung ga, miray na kulu’ muwah autuan cu kulu’ masacka’ cami i mama’.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ini’ paktatuhi’ cku imuwag ni mama’ ku autuan cu kulu’, miray cu kulu’ ga cupilapilag ru tayhuk la.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: kiya a wahti’ ka sasaanan cu qaqasinu i beh na imuwag ni mama’, maglu cami gumlu na tamayray musa’ i sasaanan cu qaqasinu.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: rasun cami ni mama’ suman cu kating, miyt ru gumlu cu ramayi’ i sasaanan cu qaqasinu.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: gabiyan laru, musa’ cami maneq i naniqan qalang quwis.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: payux a kulu’ i qalang quwis, ru gumlu cami na utubay musa’ kiya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: mateqru’ maneq papagiyay cami ga, quriqun ku utubay la, asi cami glu cu bas’ musa’ imuwag la.
S.TRANSL: 吃飽飯要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家了。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tayhuk cami Taype’ kahani la, ini’ baqi kiiy luwan ni mama’ ku utubay la qu?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有？
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: kiya i Tabilas ku imuwag niyam cu ulaqi’ kuwing na’, mateq kuwing laru, magnuhyi’ cami i Miyawli’ la, aring kiya maqinux cami quwis ruu’ kahani.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在Tabilas，上學以後，就搬到了Miyawli’，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Tabilas. After I started school, we moved to Miyawli’ and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: ru’ cu muhngeq gabagan cku kaal kahani ga, muwah kuwing ki yulah mitaal maskakaru’ cku nanabakis i tinqalangan, miki baqun mu tikay ku Gagagaga’ na Itaal nanak.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: mamaspat kinamlapgan a kaal nku nabakis la, ga’ ulaaqi’ na’ i talan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: paqucan mu mha, “nanuwan ku kayi’ ka baqun su’? ” balayq cubalabalay a kayi’ niya’ na Matu’uwal, baaq uwi kumaal cu kayi’ na Siputu’ ru kayi’ na Gipun.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的汶水泰雅語說得很流利，也會說客家話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: paqucan mu hiya’ ru baqun mu la, aqumuwani ka minkibaq cu ulaqi’ na’ hiya’ cu kayi’ na Gipun, Itaal uwi ku glu niya’, ru habaag a Siputu’ ka baqun niya’ cu matawwaw, kahi’ payux ku kayi’ ka baqun niya’ i sipakaal.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太也是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: payux ku sipanqaquu’ nku nabakis ka Gagagaga’ na qaqaluwaap cu maskakaru’ cami.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: bali niyam kiiy baqun muung kahabaag, ga’ alan niyam na soci’ cu qalimu’, ru pakbalayq lawwi nabalbalayqun i muung.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: ini’ baqibaqi cuqaang ku Gaga’ nanak cu ukaqi’, sikitaal cku Itaal kuwing ga, ini’ kabalbalayq cubalay a kisleq.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: ararruwa payux tikay ku baqun lru’, ararruwa i baqun mha, masqaqutux cu ini’ cubalay packa’ kin cuquleq ku Itaal, sipturahu mu cubalay uwi.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為原住民族，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Atayal is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: ma’uwah imuwag i gabgabiyan kisa’ i suwayi’ na mamaliku la.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: musa’ kuwing ki yaki’ i mabainasan cu raramat mabaynay cu waylung, tatahuk i suwayi’ na mamaliku i kumgabayan.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: kiya kahabaag a mica na’ kiniku’ ka paruxaw i babinasan cu raramat cu hinasun niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mabaynay cami cu kungsincay, saku ru caypu ka matanah.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: humuwaw ku kiya matibaynay cu uquuqu’ i kiyl mha, “lalbing cubalay ku pangran ru qaym mu, baynay tikay ga!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: mabaynay cami cu pangran ru qaym la.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: humaynas cami cku babinasan cu hyi’ ga, kumaal ku lawpan mha, “nanuwan ku babinasun su’? rahuwal cu magnabalay ku waykung sawni’, tugal kabhul i qutux.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: mamati’ cuqaang mha i yaki’, paqucan niya’ ku lawpan mha, “pakabalayq i mahnuk tikay? ”
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: asikinaga mahnuk cubalay la, iqat babaqun i mahahuwi’ lga mha kumaal ku lawpan.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kumaal ku tagi kiyl ka lawpan mha, “uwah mabaynay cu quleh mu, rahuwal cu mahnuk ku quleh mu.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: babaw niya’ lru, mabaynay cami cu waylung ru quleh uwi, tahkun cu qutux cu naniqan ka raramat musa’ imuwag la.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: ingasu nagaun la, ini’ saluwi uwi a kaal la.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天也黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: muwah a kayi’ na qanawan ni suwayi’ na mamaliku mha, “asipatubaah aqeh muhngeq ku hitay la, asiki hahungiqan babaw lga ma’uhwa ci la.”
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: payux ku tinahuk laru, asi ta’ patgiquni i maneq la mha i yaki’.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: kurunguun niyam ku rawirawin, maglu kumnagabaiyan ku makasiusiun ca naniqan ka raramat.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: kiya caxa’ baays mi mateq ka Kaynu’, mamati’ umungi’ i maras cu qaraqarax.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kaynu’，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kaynu’, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: mateq ga, kabawx ki baays mateq cu papateq, papawng cu pinateq quqa ruwas ka papatiqan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: manaxleq, magnapusal, magnatuu’, pakabaxan nha’ cu qaraqarax.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: asikinaga, kiya qutux hmut niya’ ka aqeh, kabawx cu qaraqarax ga mamati’ ini’ pasayu.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: babaw niya’ ru ini’ nha’ pakikabaxi cu qaraqarax la.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: riax ka qutux, maglu cami kahabaag musa’ i magunawu’.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: maki musa’ latanux Kaynu’ cu makiya i raneq, ga’ umungi’ maras cu cacawm cu qaqutian hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kaynu’想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kaynu’ wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: kabawx kinku baays niya’ mateq cu cacawm cu qaqutian, asikinaga ciyukun nha’ kahabaag mha, “ini’ cu aras uwi yu!”
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: maimag mangilis cu manata’ i Kaynu’ mha, “micuwa’ cimu kahabaag ka ini’ pakabaxani kuwing cu cacawm cu qaqutian!”
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Kaynu’ burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kalun nku baays mateq mha, “aqeh gi ini’ su’ aras nanak, anauwi ga sipkabawx su’ cu qaraqarax ga, ini’ su’ pasiyugi kariariax!”
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: kincasan, magagaaboq tayhuk papatiqan i Kaynu’, sipasayu kahabaag ni Kaynu’ ku qaraqarax ka kinabaxan niya’ kinku baays niya’ kahabaag la.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kaynu’ 很早就到學校了，Kaynu’ 把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kaynu’ arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: situbun niya’ kahabaag ku baybaays niya’ mha, “paaras kuwing cubalay cu qaraqarax mu nanak i babaw niya’ la, ru mahuway cimu ka sisiwaal mamu pakabawx kuwing ku qaraqarax mamu cku riax ka ini’ ka isting. mahuway cimu! mahuway cimu cubalabalay!”
S.TRANSL: Kaynu’向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。謝謝你們！真的非常謝謝你們！
Kaynu’ apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: paqaluwaap na itaal i tinqalangan i yaba’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: cu ulaqi’ cu na’ ga, umubu’ cu takis ru mahangal na patus humakay i mahantan yaba’ ki mama’.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: saaluwan lga, awni nha’ rasan lku qinaluwaap nha’ ka qaqasinu.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: mahananu’ ga bawwak na lahulahu, mahananu’ ga apit, iy makiya a gilaqung uwi.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: gayhun nha’ i sugagay gawng ru siqasu kahabaag cku itaal i tiqalangan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口叉路的溪邊將獵物分分解切好後，分享給部落族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: mamati’ mi pakibugan i yaba’ mha paglu ci musa’ qumaluwaap uwi.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，我也要跟著去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: kumaal yaba’ mha rahuwal kuwing lga rarasun cu niya’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: baaq uwi kabalay cu sasiyahing cu qaqasinu ku mamaliku i tinqalangan, kabalay cu tatiruweq ca wariyung, tatiruweq ca kukuy.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，製作套頸或套腳陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making head-hold traps and leg-hold traps.

S.FORM: baaq i puquluwang i yaba’, kumaal i yaba’ mha, tatiruweq cu gilaqung ku hani, asiki nabalbalayqun mitaal ku tuqi na qasinu, kakbahneq, sukuun cku hahakayan na qasinu ku quluwang.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: naki ti ini’ kanga’ gumlu kinku nanabakis musa’ i qumaluwaap mha cu ru’, makaruux ci makibaq kabalay cu sasiyahing cu qbuqbux kariariax, ini’ kaingasu ru’ tiruweq cubalay lku sinku’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: talan ni yaba’ ru kalun cu niya’ mha pakacapaang kuwing na patqaqasinu inga’’
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: rahuwal ci la kahani, mapanga’ ci cu tawnux ru saliy mu, gumlu ci yaba’ musa’ qumaluwaap la.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: muwah tinqalangan ga, siqasu kahabaag ku tiniruwrq cku qutux cu glu.
S.TRANSL: 回部落時，將獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: kumaal yaba’ mha, asi ta’ ki situbun ku huway na nanabakis, bayqan ta’ niya’ cu tiniruweq ka payux.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: masicuqi’ cu musa’ ’i’ matas ’i’ kasasanan la.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: musa’ cu i’ papatasan ga’, umungi cu maras cu’ kabang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ini’ cu aras cu’ ani nanuwan ka’ qaraqarax.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: matas cu ga’, maglug cu ki’ rawin mu mital cu’ ruwas.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: macacpung cu ga’, kabaxan cu na’ rawin mu ku’ papatiq ru’ cacawam cu’ pinatiq.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kalun cu nku’ papasibaq maha’, “nabuwibuwi ’i’ tihway babaw niya’ laxi ku’ masicuqi lawwi la.”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Yumin ku’ capaang mu na’ rawin. ulaqi’ nku’ Itaal ’i’ hiya’ uwi.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Yumin，他也是泰雅族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Yumin, and he is also an Tayal child.

S.FORM: maglug cami matas cku’ tinqalangan na’ Tabilas.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在圓墩部落讀書。
We study together in the Tabilas tribe.

S.FORM: maglug cami mung cu’ kuss ki’ nanabakis ’i’ kariariax. baq cami kumaal cu’ kai’ na’ Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

S.FORM: ibabawiq ru’ kithu cu. irarawq ru’ mahikang ’i’ Yumin.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Yumin很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Yumin is short and thin.

S.FORM: lawkah cubalay ’i’ Yumin, balaiq naha’ kahabag ’i’ hiya’.
S.TRANSL: Yumin很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Yumin is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: yuntunghuwei nku’ papatasan ’i’ sawni, payux ku’ papakal nku’ papatasan na’ macacpung.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school’s sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: kiya ku’ humuluy cu’ siniyug, kumcacri’ cu’ mari’, mataliyum, yugi’ ru’ cumbu’ cu’ sali’.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: macacpung cu ’i’ mataliyum.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: atuna’ mataliyum cu ga’, mataku’ cu la. masiramux ku’ tari’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: asikina ga’ macaqrux cu ru’ ini cu hngaw ’i’ mataliyum.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: tayhuk cu cku’ langaag ga’, maqas kahabag ku’ itaal.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ani cu ini agal cu’ tigiqutux ga’, asikinaga maqas ci cubalay gi’ naqalun mu ku’ macacpung la.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn’t get first place, I’m glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: minusa’ cu ki’ yaba’ mi mitaal ’i’ mama’ mu cu’ hisa’.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: mapangih ku’ kukuy ni’ mama’ la.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kalun cami niya’ maha’, mabuka’ ru kiya’ qutux a’ kug cku’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: kiya’ kabalay cu’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag ’i’ hiya’ ga’, asi papsihuwaw cku’ rinamuwaag na’ imuwaag.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: rasun ni’ yaba’ ku’ hi’ na’ kating ru pinnong. sibiq niya’ ’i’ mama’ la.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: maskakaru’ cu ki’ mama’ cku’ qaqilpan. payux ku’ sikaal cu niya’ ka’ kus.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: ini cu pagiyay na’ ga’, tarahuwalun cu ni’ mama’ maha’, ibabawiq ru ara’ruwa’ si’ magbatunux la.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: kumaal cu maha, “ atuna balaiq ku’ kukuy ni’ mama’ la ga’, ma’uwah ’i’ maganaw ’i’ imuwaag mu babaw niya’ uwi. ”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.\""
I said, \When your foot gets better

S.FORM: cku’ kaal ka’ 2022, makaal ku’ sebu maha’, senbenceng nku’ Yencumin ga’ balaiq patasi nanaq cu’ ralu’ na’ Itaal.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: paqucan mi Kyusi’ na’ Baay ka’ kiya cku’ tinqalangan ka’ mugumalaq ka’ minusa’ ’i’ masina’ cu’ patasi nanaq ku’ ralu’ na’ Itaal cku’ senbenceng cku’ sebu.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Kyusi’ na’ Baay。
I interviewed Kyusi’ na’ Baay, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: makaal cu ki’ hiya’ cku’ a’hangiqan ka’ hani. ma’usa’ cu mitaal ’i’ hiya’.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: maskakaru’ cami ka’ hani ga’, kaalun cu niya’ ku’ ralu’ niya’ ka’ minuwah inu’. sipakababaq niya’ kuwing ku’ imuwag niya’, tinqalangan niya’.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: paqucan mi hiya’, micuwa’ su’ ka’ asiki yugun ku’ ralu’ su’. aqih ku’ capang ka’ pinatas cu’ cunga’ pisa’?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: kaalun cu niya’ maha’, aqih gi’ pinatiq nku’ Tu’iya’ ga’, ini baqi nababalaiq ’i’ papkital cu’ cuquliq ku’ ralu’ niya’, pakaal cu’ buwinah ku’ cuquliq na’ maha’, “Kyusiyenseng”. kahi payux ku’ sumsasiyaq ka’ kai’.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng

S.FORM: kumaal ’i’ Kyusi’ na’ Baay maha’, “yani cubalay ku’ ralu’ ta’ ka’ pinatiq nku’ Yencumin. ralu’ mu ga’ yani ku’ ralu’ na’ Itaal niyam, qutux cu’ imuwaag niyam, senben niyam, wana’ ara’ruwa’ payux ku’ itaal ka’ musa’ ’i’ kumiyum cku’ ralu’ naha’ nanaq.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Kyusi’ na’ Baay said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: minusa’ cu ki’ yaki’ sumku’ cu’ qaraxqarax i’ ma’a’utuan cu’ qaraxqarax cu’ hisa’. rasun ni’ yaki’ ku’ pinumuwa’ niya’ nanaq ka’ paruxaw. kabalay uwi cu’ naniqun na’ Yencumin.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: balaiq na’ itaal kahabag ku’ saskuan cu’ qaraxqarax ni’ yaki’. payux ku’ itaal mabaynay cu’ laciyaw ru rawhing. payux ku’ itaal muwah ’i’ maniq cu’ tinahuk niya’.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: balaiq cubalay ku’ tinahuk niya’ ka’ mala’ ru papah. kiya’ na uwi ku’ sitahuk na’ maqaw ka’ hi’ na’ bawak. kinsawkan ga’, payux ku’ itaal muwah ’i’ mitaal. payux ku’ itaal ka’ muwah ’i’ matibalung cku’ saskuan cu’ qaraxqarax.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: tumahuk cu’ naniqun ’i’ yaki’ ga’, kiya’ cu bih niya’ humuluy cu’ itaal. kiya’ kuwing cku’ bih humuwag maha’, “pinumuwa’ nanaq ku’ paruxaw, ukas a’ iyu’ ru nabuwibuwi ’i’ uwah ’i’ mabanay ke. ”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: ini ka’ingasug ru binasun kahabag ku’ paruxaw niyam. kumaal ’i’ yaki’ maha’, “ulung isu’ ku’ rumag.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: tiku waw ka hani ga’, baqun mu ku’ pinkibaqan na’ pinumuwa’ ru naniqun na’ Yencumin ru kinma’buk ku’ sumku’ cu’ qaraxqarax na’ waw.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: talan mu ’i’ yaki’ mu ka’ balaiq niya’ cubalay ku’ naniqun cu’ cunga. yani ku’ sikasalaw mu ga’.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
